content.prompt: ​A decibel is a unit used to measure loudness of sound. The function d{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} defined by dY=10log10Y·1012{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} gives the measure, in decibels, as a function of intensity Y{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}, in watts per square meter (m2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}). The function g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} defined by gY=10log10Y{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is a different scale related to intensity, and the graph of d{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} is a translation of the graph of g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}. Which of the following gives the graphs of g{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} and d{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} ?

choices.label:
​

  • The x axis is labeled Intensity (watts per meter squared) and ranges from 0 to 35 in increments of 5.
  •  The y axis is labeled Decibels and ranges from negative 20 to 140 in increments of 20. 
  • Two curves are shown. All coordinates are approximate. 
  • One curve is solid and labeled d.

 Moving from left to right:

  • The curve begins at (0.1 comma negative 20).
  • The curve increases sharply to reach (1 comma 120).
  • The curve continues to increase gradually, passing through (10 comma 130), (20 comma 135), and (30 comma 137).
  • The curve exits the window at (37 comma 138). 

The second curve is dashed and labeled g. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve begins at (0.1 comma negative 20).
  • The curve increases to reach (1 comma 0).
  • The curve continues to increase gradually, passing through (10 comma 10), (20 comma 15), and (30 comma 17).
  • The curve exits the window at (37 comma 18).

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
